question: What does PRINCE2 stand for?
answers: A. Project Resource Integration and Control Environment
C. Project Integration and Control Environment

question: Which of the following is NOT a PRINCE2 principle?
answers: D. Tailor to Suit the Project Environment

question: What is the purpose of the Initiating a Project process?
answers: A. To ensure that the project has a sound basis before starting work
B. To ensure that the project is completed on time
C. To ensure that the project is within budget
D. To ensure that the project is completed to the required quality

question: Who is responsible for the day-to-day management of the project?
Which of the following is a PRINCE2 theme?
What is the purpose of the Managing a Stage Boundary process?
answers: A. To plan the next stage of the project
B. To ensure that the project is completed on time
C. To ensure that the project is within budget
D. To ensure that the project is completed to the required quality

question: Which of the following is a PRINCE2 role?
What is the purpose of the Directing a Project process?
answers: A. To ensure that the project is completed on time
B. To ensure that the project is within budget
C. To ensure that the project is completed to the required quality
D. To ensure that the project is initiated and directed properly

question: Which of the following is a PRINCE2 product?
What is the purpose of the Closing a Project process?
answers: A. To ensure that the project is completed on time
B. To ensure that the project is within budget
C. To ensure that the project is completed to the required quality
D. To ensure that the project is formally closed
